text: George W. Wilson (1843–1900) was a Commissioner of Internal Revenue at the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) in the United States. == Life and career == Wilson was born on September 13, 1843 in Preble County, Ohio. During the American Civil War, Wilson became a private in the Union Army as part of the Fifty-fouth Ohio Volunteer Infantry at the age of eighteen. He left the army at the end of the war as a first lieutenant. In 1866, Wilson began to practice law. In 1969, Wilson began working for the Internal Revenue Service where he served in various positions. He eventually became head of the IRS. Wilson served as IRS Commissioner from March 1, 1899 to November 27, 1900. Wilson died on November 27, 1900 in Washington, D.C. == References == Category:1843 births Category:1900 deaths Category:Commissioners of Internal Revenue Category:McKinley administration personnel Category:Union Army soldiers Category:People from Preble County, Ohio
title: George W. Wilson (IRS Commissioner)
